meta.hint:
Use 'has' if the sentence is about one person, animal, place, or, thing.
Example - Brian has a little brother. Example - She has two ice-creams.
Use have if the sentence is about more than one person, animal, place or thing. Also, use 'have' if the sentence is about you or I.
Example - The girls have many friends. Example - You have a pretty dress. Example - I have a dog.
meta.question: Complete the sentence with has or have.
